text: Syria and its ally Russia have blamed
Israel for a missile attack on a
government airbase the Interfax news
agency said Israeli warplanes had
carried out the strikes from Lebanese
airspace Monday's attack Hitler TS
airbase known as t4 near the city of
Homs reports say several people have
died
some of them Iranian this follows a
suspected chemical attack on a
rebel-held area near the Syrian capital
Damascus an attack that has been blamed
on the Syrian government our
correspondent Yolanda nel has been
monitoring events from Jerusalem well
the information we have is coming from
the Russian Defense Ministry and also
from the Syrians
and reports saying that two Israeli f15
or planes flying several missiles
between 1/2 past midnight and 1 o'clock
in the morning GMT at this airbase which
is in the centre of Syria it's the
largest military airbase in the country
we understand that some of the missiles
struck the western part of the airfield
now according to the Syrian Observatory
for Human Rights which monitors events
in Syria from the UK it's saying at
least 14 people were killed there
including Iranians and we do know that
at this particular airbase as well as
the Syrians there are Iranians also
members of the Lebanese armed group
Hezbollah and also of course Russians as
well the Russians say that there were no
Russian specialists that were injured in
this incident here the Israeli military
spokesperson is declining to comment but
that is quite typical because we have
had dozens of strikes carried out by
Israel we know inside Syria in recent
years without in most cases the Israelis
commenting on them now the US was very
quick to say that it was not behind this
attack but do you think that the
Pentagon might have known this strike
was coming well suddenly even the
Syrians first suspected that it was the
u.s. that was behind this airstrike
after that warning from President Trump
after a suspected chemical weapon attack
in duma in the rebel-held town there
that President Bashar al-assad
would have a big price to pay of course
the u.s. is an extremely important ally
of Israel so we could expect that the
Israelis would tell Washington what it
was what they were planning also perhaps
the Russians too because we do know that
the Russians have in the past besides
having very good relations with the
Israelis in general they have got
involved try to de-escalate the
situation particularly back in February
when actually Israel targeted this very
airfield after an Iranian drone was said
to have been flown into Israeli airspace
and that was actually one of the most
recent dangerous flare-ups in this
confrontation we believe that Moscow got
involved to calm the situation at that
point you use the word de-escalation you
land but that seems a little unlikely
now given also what President Trump has
been tweeting it about the man he calls
animal Assad and the fact that his new
security adviser National Security
Advisor John Bolton is just a taken up
the role today and he's known for being
very hawkish and indeed an Israeli
officials also have been coming out
urging the u.s. to take action against
President Assad if as seems to have been
the case his forces are found to have
carried out this chemical weapons attack
of course it's about a year ago that the
u.s. fired
cruise missiles at a government airbase
in retaliation for another suspected
chemical attack back in April 2017 so
now that there is a lot of there are a
lot of people looking towards Washington
also towards the French president
Emmanuel macron who has come out saying
that there should be a strong response
taken against the Syrian regime in this
case but Israel for itself makes clear
that it has what it sees as its national
security threat to its own red lines and
they are typically to try to stop any
advanced weaponry being passed to
Hezbollah its sworn enemy and also of
course it's extremely concerned about
Iran trying to establish a permanent
military presence inside Syria and we've
just heard from russia's Foreign
Minister Sergei
Lavrov who says the overnight airstrike
is a dangerous development
he has also insisted there is no sign of
the Syrian government using chemical
weapons in Duma he said the area has
been visited by our military specialists
and representatives from the Syrian Red
Crescent they found no traces of
chlorine or any other chemical substance
being used against peaceful civilians
